channel.title: latent variables on YoungStatS
channel.description: Recent content in latent variables on YoungStatS

item.title: Causal discovery in the presence of discrete latent variables
item.description: We address the problem of causal structure learning in the presence of hidden variables. Given a target variable and a vector of covariates, we are trying to infer the set of observable causal parents of the target variable. There are many good reasons for being interested in causal predictors. Given a target variable $Y$, and a vector $X = (X^1, \dots, X^d)$ of $d$ covariates, we are trying to infer the set $S^* \subseteq \{1, \dots, d\}$ of observable causal parents of $Y$.
